speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.maxC:
Maximum number of seeds that can be queued.
Once the limit is reached, no more seeds will be queued until the current world has been reset.
Maximum number of seeds that can be generating at the same time.
Maximum number of seeds that can be generating at the same time while on the Wall Screen.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.maxW:
Stops generating a world at the set percentage unless it is locked.
Note that it will still wait for WorldPreview to be configured before freezing the world.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.chun:
Sets the rendering of chunkmaps of currently generating seeds.
Show - Render an overlay with all the chunkmaps
Transparent - Render a transparent overlay with all the chunkmaps
Hide - Do not render the chunkmaps

How big the chunkmaps should be rendered.
§6They will still be affected by GUI Scale!
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.useW: Shows a wall of all worlds between resets where you can select worlds you want to join or worlds you want to reset.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.repl: If disabled, a locked instance will only get replaced once Reset All Instances or Focus Reset is used.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.bypa: Bypasses the Wall Screen and immediately puts you into the next locked instance if possible.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.unli: By default Minecraft limits the FPS you can get when not in a world to 60, this option removes that limit for the Wall Screen.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.back: Builds previews in the background before they start being rendered, allowing for a smoother transition when loading a new preview onto the Wall Screen.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.useP:
Instead of synchronizing access to surface builders between instances, create multiple copies to be used in parallel.
§cTo update this option restart the game.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.lazy: When launching a world on the SeedQueue Thread, creating a UserCache for a world takes a considerable amount of time and may slow down your resets. If this option is enabled, the UserCache will be build when joining the world instead.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.seed: Sets the thread priority for the SeedQueue Thread which creates seeds to generate.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.back:
Sets the amount of Worker Threads for seeds generating in queue while in a world.
§6It is recommended to not set this value higher than the amount of processors your CPU has, but not lower than the Max Generating Seeds option.
Sets the thread priority for SeedQueue Worker Threads.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.wall:
Sets the amount of Worker Threads for seeds generating in queue while on wall.
§6It is recommended to not set this value higher than the amount of processors your CPU has, but not lower than the Max Generating Seeds (Wall) option.
Sets the thread priority for Wall Worker Threads.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.chun: Sets the number of Sodium Chunk Update Threads per preview on the Wall Screen.
Sets the thread priority for Sodium Chunk Update Threads on the Wall Screen.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.useW:
Launches an extra thread that prints out the main threads stacktrace every 10 seconds to diagnose freezing issues.
§cTo update this option restart the game.
speedrunapi.config.seedqueue.option.benc:
Every time the wall screen is opened, a benchmark will start for the given amount of resets.
When the benchmark finishes it logs the results.
